page.title: 13ASHDOWN PARK
page.content: {Ashdown Park}is now the {Barclays Bank {Training Centre.}It comprises 186 acres overlooking the Ashdown Forest and there are six full time gardeners employed to maintain the beautifully laid out landscape. The buildings date back to the beginning of the 19th century and they have had a variety of occupants.In 1919 it became a{convent} and a beautiful chapel was added. In 1971 the Estate was taken over by the United States International University. The University did not stay long and in 1974 Ashdown Park was conveyed to Barclays Bank Limited for use as a Group Management Training Centre.The Conversion took over {three {million}pounds.Businessmen come from all over the world. There are about 100 course members each week, and there is a staff of about 120 to look after them.
